title: What To Expect From Michigan’s New Auto Insurance Laws On July 1
text: In 1973, Michigan passed a no-fault auto insurance system. If you are hurt in a car accident under this system, you’ll make a claim on your own auto insurance, no matter who caused the accident.

title: How to deal with Michigan’s new auto insurance law
text: That’s medical insurance. The state calls it “qualified medical coverage,” such as Blue Cross Blue Shield or another carrier that specifically tells you it covers auto accidents and you can opt out of PIP.
